message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with a distributed tracking problem, which involves processing and transmitting data over a network. This suggests that it could belong to several sub-categories, including Information Theory (cs.IT), Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC), Systems and Control (cs.SY), Machine Learning (cs.LG), and Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI). However, since the paper focuses on the use of erasure correcting codes to improve the accuracy and timeliness of updates, Information Theory (cs.IT) is the most likely sub-category. The other sub-categories are also relevant because they involve aspects of distributed computing, control theory, and machine learning, which are all important components of the proposed scheme.
